tit.e: Gyosei (Poems or Songs Written by the Emperor)
Gyosei (Poems or Songs Written by the Emperor)
tit.cmt: タイトルですので、補足は削除しました。

sen.j: 御製（ぎょせい）とは、天皇や皇帝、また皇族が手ずから書いたり作ったりした文章（政令の類は除く）・詩歌・絵画などをいう。
sen.e: Gyosei refers to documents (except for decrees), poems and paintings that have been personally written or created by the emperors and royal family members.
Gyosei refers to documents (aside from decrees), poems and paintings that have been personally written or created by emperors or royal family members.
Gyosei refers to documents (aside from decrees), poems and paintings that have been personally written or created by emperors or royal family members.

sen.j: 日本では、御製というと一般に天皇が詠んだ和歌のことをいうことが多い。
sen.e: In Japan, however, gyosei generally refers to the poems composed by the emperor.
Within Japan, the term gyosei is generally used to refer to waka (poems) composed by the emperor.
sen.cmt: added waka parethesis around (poems); eliminated "however" since there is no direct contrast with the previous sentence being made
sen.e: Within Japan, the term gyosei is generally used to refer to waka (poems) composed by the emperor.

sen.j: 代表的な作品として唐の太宗 (唐)の手になる大慈恩寺・大雁塔に刻された「聖教序」（御製御書）などがある。
sen.e: The representative gyosei include Shuji Shogyojo (the writing in the emperor's hand) by Taiso, Tang tai zong (Tang) which was engraved on Daigando at Daijion-ji Temple.
Exemplary works of gyosei include the Shuji Shogyojo (writing done by the emperor's hand) by Taiso and Tang Tai Zong (Tang) that was engraved on the Daigando at the Daijon-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Exemplary works of gyosei include the 'Shogyojo' (writing done by the emperor's hand) by Taiso (Tang tai zong), that was engraved on the Daiganto at the Daijion-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 日本では天皇および皇室、皇族に関する敬語の一つである。
sen.e: In Japan gyosei is an honorific expressions used in relation to the emperor, Imperial Family and royalties.
In Japan, gyosei is an honorific expression used in reference to the emperor, Imperial family and other royalites.
